column4: If I boot my live usb with current changes in casper-rw, can I then have it copy the casper-rw file or it's contents to the ramdisk so it uses it from there and not from my key?
Each time I tell it to boot to ram and it's done I yank the key and it starts thorwing stupid errors and stuff starts crashing.
Had no luck trying to merge casper-rw and filesystem.squashfs into one and recreating the squashfs.
Did that and got tons of weird errors and crap popping up but it did actually boot everything to ram.
are you using the toram option of casper?
yeah
are you removing the casper-rw partition?
I would like to.
your not going to be able to get the best of both worlds
I don't care if I can't change anything after it boots up or if the whoel thing gets wiped out on reboot.
so you just want some extra packages pre-installed?

I've done it once by mounting the two files in another install and rsyncing from casper-rw to the mounted squashfs and it works, but it screws up a lot of random crap so I figured there was a better way.
Just can't find it yet.
no, I want all kinds of neat crap done and saved to that it all loads to ram.
make your own custom livecd https://help.ubuntu.com/community/LiveCDCustomization
yeah
I did that.
then whats the problem?
I'm retarded.  This whole time I've been trying to get my changes from casper-rw to the sqaushfs file that I didn't think to just start over and make all my changes in chroot.
I was focused on merging the two....
Thanks for the directional guidance.  :)
put anything you want in /home/ubuntu in /etc/skel
yeah, you shoudl of saw the look on my face when I realized that....
